snippet: Three British organizations said they had filed a legal challenge to the online surveillance programs of the British spy agency the Government Communications Headquarters.
abstract: Three British organizations say they have filed a legal challenge in European Court of Human Rights to the online surveillance programs of British spy agency the Government Communications Headquarters; groups hope to prove that collection of metadata is illegal breach of right to privacy.
lead_paragraph: Three British organizations said they had filed a legal challenge to the online surveillance programs of the British spy agency the Government Communications Headquarters.
